Sosnogorsk (Russian: Сосного́рск; Komi:: The settlement was first established in 1939 as a railway station. It was known as Izhma (Ижма) until 1957. During the Soviet era
Sösnagort) is a town in the Komi Republ: a corrective labor camp was located here. Gas giant Gazprom has a natural-gas condensate factory in the town.

Sosnogorsk (Russian: Сосного́рск; Komi:: Within the framework of administrative divisions
Russia: together with two urban-type settlement administrative territories (comprising the urban-type settlements of Voyvozh and Nizhny Odes and three rural localities) and thirteen rural localities
located on the Izhma River. Population:: incorporated as the town of republic significance of Sosnogorsk—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
757 (2010 Census); 29: the town of republic significance of Sosnogorsk is incorporated as Sosnogorsk Municipal District; the town of Sosnogorsk and thirteen rural localities are incorporated within it as Sosnogorsk Urban Settlement. The two urban-type settlement administrative territories are incorporated into two urban settlements within the municipal district.
